Detailed Description

Represents a Gamaray dimension.

Member Function Documentation

- (void) resolveIdentifiers  

Resolves the concrete location for features that only have a location identifier.

+ (void) startParsingWithXMLParser: (NSXMLParser *)  parser
element: (NSString *)  element
attributes: (NSDictionary *)  attributes
notifyTarget: (id)  target
selector: (SEL)  selector
userInfo: (id)  userInfo 

Starts parsing a dimension using the given XML parser and start element. Notifies the given target after the end element has been parsed, passing the result as the first argument which is either an instance of ARDimension or nil when parsing has failed.

Parameters:
parser Must be non-nil.
element The name of the start element. Must be non-nil.
attributes The attributes of the start element.
target The target that will be notified when parsing is done. Optional.
selector The selector used when notifying the target. Required if a target was given.
userInfo Information that is passed as the second argument to the target. Optional.

Property Documentation

- (NSDictionary *) assets [read, copy]

Assets that are used in the dimension, keyed by identifier.

- (NSArray *) features [read, copy]

Features that are present in the dimension.

- (NSDictionary *) locations [read, copy]

Locations that are used in the dimension, keyed by identifier.

- (NSString *) name [read, copy]

The name of this dimension, which can be an arbitrary string or nil.

- (NSArray *) overlays [read, copy]

Overlays that are present in the dimension.

- (CLLocationDistance) radarRadius [read, assign]

The radius in which objects should be displayed on the radar, in meters.

- (CLLocationDistance) refreshDistance [read, assign]

Distance the device moved after which this dimension becomes invalid and should be refreshed.

- (NSTimeInterval) refreshTime [read, assign]

Amount of time after which this dimension becomes invalid and should be refreshed.

- (NSURL *) refreshURL [read, retain]

URL used when this dimension needs to be refreshed.

- (BOOL) relativeAltitude [read, assign]

Indicates whether altitudes in this dimension are relative to the device's altitude.
